co.cask.cdap.api.spark
Interface SparkContext

All Superinterfaces:
RuntimeContext
public interface SparkContext
extends RuntimeContext

Spark job execution context. This context is shared between CDAP and User's Spark job. This interface exposes two prominent methods:

  1. readFromDataset(String, Class, Class): Allows user to read a Dataset as an RDD
  2. writeToDataset(Object, String, Class, Class): Allows user to write a RDD to a Dataset
Classes implementing this interface should also have a Spark Context member of appropriate type on which these method acts.

Methods inherited from interface co.cask.cdap.api.RuntimeContext
getRuntimeArguments
 

Method Detail

getSpecification

SparkSpecification getSpecification()
Returns:
The specification used to configure this Spark job instance.

getLogicalStartTime

long getLogicalStartTime()
Returns the logical start time of this Spark job. Logical start time is the time when this Spark job is supposed to start if this job is started by the scheduler. Otherwise it would be the current time when the job runs.

Returns:
Time in milliseconds since epoch time (00:00:00 January 1, 1970 UTC).

readFromDataset

<T> T readFromDataset(String datasetName,
                      Class<?> kClass,
                      Class<?> vClass)
Create a Spark RDD that uses Dataset as input source

Type Parameters:
T - type of RDD
Parameters:
datasetName - the name of the Dataset to be read as an RDD
kClass - the key class
vClass - the value class
Returns:
the RDD created from Dataset
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - if the SparkContext is not yet initialized

writeToDataset

<T> void writeToDataset(T rdd,
                        String datasetName,
                        Class<?> kClass,
                        Class<?> vClass)
Writes a Spark RDD to Dataset

Type Parameters:
T - type of RDD
Parameters:
rdd - the rdd to be stored
datasetName - the name of the Dataset where the RDD should be stored
kClass - the key class
vClass - the value class
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - if the SparkContext is not yet initialized

readFromStream

<T> T readFromStream(String streamName,
                     Class<?> vClass)
Create a Spark RDD that uses complete Stream as input source

Type Parameters:
T - type of RDD
Parameters:
streamName - the name of the Stream to be read as an RDD
vClass - the value class
Returns:
the RDD created from Stream

readFromStream

<T> T readFromStream(String streamName,
                     Class<?> vClass,
                     long startTime,
                     long endTime)
Create a Spark RDD that uses Stream as input source

Type Parameters:
T - type of RDD
Parameters:
streamName - the name of the Stream to be read as an RDD
vClass - the value class
startTime - the starting time of the stream to be read in milliseconds. To read from the starting of the stream set this to 0
endTime - the ending time of the streams to be read in milliseconds. To read up to the end of the stream set this to Long.MAX_VALUE
Returns:
the RDD created from Stream

readFromStream

<T> T readFromStream(String streamName,
                     Class<?> vClass,
                     long startTime,
                     long endTime,
                     Class<? extends StreamEventDecoder> decoderType)
Create a Spark RDD that uses Stream as input source according to the given StreamEventDecoder

Type Parameters:
T - type of RDD
Parameters:
streamName - the name of the Stream to be read as an RDD
vClass - the value class
startTime - the starting time of the stream to be read in milliseconds. To read from the starting of the stream set this to 0
endTime - the ending time of the streams to be read in milliseconds. To read up to the end of the stream set this to Long.MAX_VALUE
decoderType - the decoder to use while reading streams
Returns:
the RDD created from Stream

getOriginalSparkContext

<T> T getOriginalSparkContext()
Returns JavaSparkContext or SparkContext depending on user's job type.

Type Parameters:
T - the type of Spark Context
Returns:
the Spark Context

getRuntimeArguments

String[] getRuntimeArguments(String argsKey)
Returns value of the given argument key as a String[]

Parameters:
argsKey - String which is the key for the argument
Returns:
String[] containing all the arguments which is indexed by their position as they were supplied

getServiceDiscoverer

ServiceDiscoverer getServiceDiscoverer()
Returns a Serializable ServiceDiscoverer for Service Discovery in Spark Program which can be passed in Spark program's closures.

Returns:
A Serializable ServiceDiscoverer

getMetrics

Metrics getMetrics()
Returns a Serializable Metrics which can be used to emit custom metrics from user's Spark program. This can also be passed in Spark program's closures and workers can emit their own metrics

Returns:
Serializable Metrics for Spark programs
